tool_description: A complete product for parsing subscribers, subscriptions, locations, hashtags, posts, as well as monitoring and filtering, full-fledged support and constant updating!
name: Instagram Parser 2024
title: Instagram Parser 2024

api_list.name: Create Task [Location Autors Parsing]
api_list.description:
#### Please note! 

- Collecting followers from verified accounts (with a blue check mark) is currently unavailable (collects no more than `50` followers ). 
- To collect the database from such accounts, we recommend using subscriber or like monitoring.
- Enabling filtering during parsing increases the database collection time significantly. We recommend that you first assemble the database without filtering, and then filter it in the appropriate section.
- Also, if you run a task to parse `100` followers , you will most likely get a number of about `80<`
- The approximate time to collect `10,000` followers is `1` hour, possibly less or more
- The final result may differ from the intermediate one, because duplicate `IDs` are deleted

optional_parameters.name: postcom1
optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Task name

optional_parameters.name: stop_post
optional_parameters.description: Stop words in the post description separated by commas or URL  to the TXT file

optional_parameters.name: white_post_match
optional_parameters.description: 0 - exact match, 1 - inexact (includes similar words). Default is 0.

optional_parameters.name: white_50post
optional_parameters.description: Keywords in the last 50 posts separated by commas or URL to the TXT file **

optional_parameters.name: option
optional_parameters.description:
Collected data: 

`1` - id, 
`2` - logins, 
`1,2` - logins and id 

(default is `1`)

optional_parameters.name: postlike2
optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: dop
optional_parameters.description:
Additional data: 

`1` - phone number
`2` - email
`3` - name
`4` - language in the description
`5` - city +address
`6` - description
`7` - hashtag subscriptions
`8` - number of subscribers
`9` - category
`10` - leave only id with additional in the results.parameters
`11` - link
`12` - json data
`13` - privacy
`14` - business
`15` - verification
`16` - country:registration date_:active ads
`17` - avatar
`18` - coefficient of engagement by likes**
`19` - coefficient of engagement by comments**
`20` - number of subscriptions
`21` - number of posts
`22` - date of the last post**

** - Parameters are not available (should not be passed) if the `$private` parameter with the value `2` is passed (only closed accounts)

optional_parameters.name: postlike1
optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: postcom2
optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: white_50post_match
optional_parameters.description: 0 - exact match, 1 - inexact (includes similar words). Default - 0. **

optional_parameters.name: limit2
optional_parameters.description:
Account limit (default is `1000`)
Max `100000`

optional_parameters.name: white_post
optional_parameters.description: Keywords in the post description separated by commas or URL  to the TXT file

optional_parameters.name: unique
optional_parameters.description:
Delete duplicates:

`0` - do not delete duplicates 

(default is `1`). 

`Please note! If account filtering is active during parsing, this parameter is ignored!`

api_list.name: Search Task or Base
api_list.description:
Search for a task or base. It is convenient if you have lost the task id, but remember the name you gave for the task, or the donor for whom the task is being performed.

You can also use this as a search for ready-made databases that users have already paired for themselves. 

In response, you will receive the last 10 tasks, taking into account the parameters that you set for the post, if you leave all the parameters empty, you will simply receive a list of the latest databases with the status completed and in progress

optional_parameters.name: tid
optional_parameters.description: ID task

optional_parameters.name: link
optional_parameters.description: URL, username, id, hashtag...

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Task name

optional_parameters.name: white_login
optional_parameters.description:
Keywords in the account login separated by commas or URL to the TXT file 

**File requirements**

You can specify a direct link to a txt file with a keyword database, in which each word must be on a new line, and the length of each line must not exceed `150` characters (otherwise the line will be truncated to this length). The file must contain no more than `350,000` lines and be no more than `8MB` in size. The file must be in one of the encodings: `utf-8, windows-1251.`
At the specified link, the server must respond with `HTTP code 200` and return the correct `Content-type header: text/plain.  `

optional_parameters.name: verified
optional_parameters.description:
Verified account: 

`1 `- yes
`2 `- no
`0 `- any 

(default `0`)

optional_parameters.name: private
optional_parameters.description:
Privacy: 

`1` - public account
`2` - private account
`0` - any 

(default `0`)

optional_parameters.description:

`1` - id
 `2` - logins
`1,2` - logins and id

(default `1`)

optional_parameters.name: ava
optional_parameters.description:

`1` - yes, 
`2` - no, 
`0` - any 

(default `0`)

#### Please note! 

- Collecting followers from verified accounts (with a blue check mark) is currently unavailable (collects no more than `50` followers ). 
- To collect the database from such accounts, we recommend using subscriber or like monitoring.
- Enabling filtering during parsing increases the database collection time significantly. We recommend that you first assemble the database without filtering, and then filter it in the appropriate section.
- Also, if you run a task to parse `100` followers , you will most likely get a number of about `80<`
- The approximate time to collect `10,000` followers is `1` hour, possibly less or more
- The final result may differ from the intermediate one, because duplicate `IDs` are deleted

optional_parameters.name: limit2
optional_parameters.description:
Account limit (default is `1000`)
Max `100000`

optional_parameters.name: stop_post_match
optional_parameters.description: 0 - exact match, 1 - inaccurate (includes similar words). Default is 0.

optional_parameters.name: postcom1
optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: postcom2
optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: option
optional_parameters.description:
Data collected: 

`1` - Post ID
`2` - Post URL
`3` - Content URL
`4` - Description
`5` - Number of likes
`6` - Number of comments
`7` - Post date
`8` - Location name
`9` - Location ID 

(default `1`)

optional_parameters.name: stop_post
optional_parameters.description: Stop words in the post description separated by commas or URL  to the TXT file

optional_parameters.name: white_post_match
optional_parameters.description: 0 - exact match, 1 - inexact (includes similar words). Default is 0.

optional_parameters.description: Task name

optional_parameters.description: Number of comments on the post from,to (default 0)

optional_parameters.name: posdate
optional_parameters.description: How many days ago posts on the hashtags specified for collection were uploaded (default `0`)

optional_parameters.name: stop_post
optional_parameters.description:
Stop words in the post description separated by commas or URL  to the TXT file 

**File requirements**

You can specify a direct link to a txt file with a keyword database, in which each word must be on a new line, and the length of each line must not exceed `150` characters (otherwise the line will be truncated to this length). The file must contain no more than `350,000` lines and be no more than `8MB` in size. The file must be in one of the encodings: `utf-8, windows-1251.`
At the specified link, the server must respond with `HTTP code 200` and return the correct `Content-type header: text/plain.  `

optional_parameters.name: white_post_match
optional_parameters.description:
`0` - exact match
`1` - imprecise (includes words with the same root)

Default is `0`.

(default `1`)

The file must contain no more than `350,000` lines and be no more than `8MB` in size. The file must be in one of the encodings: `utf-8, windows-1251.`
At the specified link, the server must respond with `HTTP code 200` and return the correct `Content-type header: text/plain.  `

optional_parameters.name: dop
optional_parameters.description:
Additional data: 

`1` - phone number
`2` - email
`3` - name
`4` - language in the description
`5` - city +address
`6` - description
`7` - hashtag subscriptions
`8` - number of subscribers
`9` - category
`10` - leave only id with additional in the results.parameters
`11` - link
`12` - json data
`13` - privacy
`14` - business
`15` - verification
`16` - country:registration date_:active ads
`17` - avatar
`18` - coefficient of engagement by likes**
`19` - coefficient of engagement by comments**
`20` - number of subscriptions
`21` - number of posts
`22` - date of the last post**

** - Parameters are not available (should not be passed) if the `$private` parameter with the value `2` is passed (only closed accounts)

api_list.name: Check Task Status
api_list.description:
#### Please note! 

- The data is updated no more than once every `5` minutes, so do not waste queries constantly updating the status of the task, just wait or configure the crown task to update the status of the task every `5-6` minutes
- If the task is still in progress and the first data has appeared, you can also download it without waiting for the task to complete

#### Please note! 

- To save your requests, you will also receive in the response a parameter such as `api_url_to_check_results`, which you can access directly without using your requests, moreover, by clicking on the link you will also receive the parameter `api_url_to_file_results` by clicking on the link you will receive a file with the result
